ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Form used/assessment name
Notes: e.g., Self-Report, Parent Form, Short Form, Revised Version

ElementDescription: In the past two weeks, have you had any physical trouble or difficulty doing these activities: Walking to the bathroom
Notes: 0 = No trouble at all; 1 = A little trouble; 2 = Some trouble; 3 = A lot of trouble; 4 = Impossible

ElementDescription: In the past two weeks, have you had any physical trouble or difficulty doing these activities: Walking upstairs
Notes: 0 = No trouble at all; 1 = A little trouble; 2 = Some trouble; 3 = A lot of trouble; 4 = Impossible

ElementDescription: In the past two weeks, have you had any physical trouble or difficulty doing these activities: Doing something with a friend (For example, playing a game)
Notes: 0 = No trouble at all; 1 = A little trouble; 2 = Some trouble; 3 = A lot of trouble; 4 = Impossible

ElementDescription: In the past two weeks, have you had any physical trouble or difficulty doing these activities: Doing chores at home
Notes: 0 = No trouble at all; 1 = A little trouble; 2 = Some trouble; 3 = A lot of trouble; 4 = Impossible

ElementDescription: In the past two weeks, have you had any physical trouble or difficulty doing these activities: Eating regular meals
Notes: 0 = No trouble at all; 1 = A little trouble; 2 = Some trouble; 3 = A lot of trouble; 4 = Impossible

ElementDescription: In the past two weeks, have you had any physical trouble or difficulty doing these activities: Being up all day without a nap or rest
Notes: 0 = No trouble at all; 1 = A little trouble; 2 = Some trouble; 3 = A lot of trouble; 4 = Impossible

ElementDescription: In the past two weeks, have you had any physical trouble or difficulty doing these activities: Riding the school bus or travelling in the car
Notes: 0 = No trouble at all; 1 = A little trouble; 2 = Some trouble; 3 = A lot of trouble; 4 = Impossible

ElementDescription: In the past two weeks, have you had any physical trouble or difficulty doing these activities: Being at school all day
Notes: 0 = No trouble at all; 1 = A little trouble; 2 = Some trouble; 3 = A lot of trouble; 4 = Impossible

ElementDescription: In the past two weeks, have you had any physical trouble or difficulty doing these activities: Doing the activities in gym class (or playing sports)
Notes: 0 = No trouble at all; 1 = A little trouble; 2 = Some trouble; 3 = A lot of trouble; 4 = Impossible

ElementDescription: In the past two weeks, have you had any physical trouble or difficulty doing these activities: Reading or doing homework
Notes: 0 = No trouble at all; 1 = A little trouble; 2 = Some trouble; 3 = A lot of trouble; 4 = Impossible

ElementDescription: In the past two weeks, have you had any physical trouble or difficulty doing these activities: Watching TV
Notes: 0 = No trouble at all; 1 = A little trouble; 2 = Some trouble; 3 = A lot of trouble; 4 = Impossible

ElementDescription: In the past two weeks, have you had any physical trouble or difficulty doing these activities: Walking the length of a football field
Notes: 0 = No trouble at all; 1 = A little trouble; 2 = Some trouble; 3 = A lot of trouble; 4 = Impossible

ElementDescription: In the past two weeks, have you had any physical trouble or difficulty doing these activities: Running the length of a football field
Notes: 0 = No trouble at all; 1 = A little trouble; 2 = Some trouble; 3 = A lot of trouble; 4 = Impossible

ElementDescription: In the past two weeks, have you had any physical trouble or difficulty doing these activities: Going shopping
Notes: 0 = No trouble at all; 1 = A little trouble; 2 = Some trouble; 3 = A lot of trouble; 4 = Impossible

ElementDescription: In the past two weeks, have you had any physical trouble or difficulty doing these activities: Getting to sleep at night and staying asleep
Notes: 0 = No trouble at all; 1 = A little trouble; 2 = Some trouble; 3 = A lot of trouble; 4 = Impossible

ElementDescription: Functional Disability Inventory Score
Notes: Sum of items fdi1 through fdi15
